modules.description: Establishes a connection to a server with configurable debug mode, host, port, and prefix. Manages message reception through a stream and allows custom handlers for incoming messages. Sends messages and gracefully closes the connection.

Writes and serializes JSON representations of message types, including private messages, general messages, and sends, using buffer and string operations. Parses JSON input from lexing buffers into these types, supporting both direct deserialization from strings and incremental reading. Handles structured data with specific fields defined in associated type definitions.

Provides functions to parse, construct, and manipulate IRC private messages, including handling prefixes, commands, and arguments. Works with structured data types representing message components such as sender information, command verbs, and parameter lists. Used to process incoming messages from IRC servers and format outgoing commands for transmission.

Provides functions for parsing IRC messages, managing plugin hooks, and handling connection loops. Works with message structures, plugin modules, and configuration records. Used to route incoming commands to specific behaviors, manage bot state during sessions, and execute predefined actions based on IRC events.

Establishes and manages a connection to an IRC server with customizable settings, handling message streams and custom processing. Serializes and parses JSON data for message types, supporting both direct and incremental deserialization. Parses and constructs IRC private messages, manipulating structured components like senders, commands, and arguments. Enables sending formatted commands, processing incoming messages, and handling structured data flows within an IRC context.
